title.narrative: Support to the AfCFTA

description.narrative:
The overall objective of the programme is to promote sustainable economic growth across the African continent by enhancing the regional economic integration and intra-African trade through the successful implementation of the African Con¬tinental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA). The Agreement establi-shing the AfCFTA has been signed by 54 of 55 African Union member states and is thus the largest free trade agreement signed since the establishment of the World Trade Organisation. It covers 1.2 billion people and a total economy worth USD 2.5 trillion.
Key results expected: - Finalization of phase two negotiations on competition policy, investment policy and intellectual property rights. - A fully operational Secretariat is established and able to efficiently monitor the implementation of the African Continental Free Trade Area. - Improved capacity amongst member states and regional economic communities to enable utilization of the new market opportunities created through the AfCFTA.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Economic Commision for Africa

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 1.1 Toolkits and materials developed, advisory services delivered, and consultations held at country level to support the completion of AFCFTA phase 1 issues.
Number of countries supported.
1.2: Capacity building for targeted countries on the measurement and analysis of services trade value chains for AfCFTA implementation.
Number of countries trained.

Output 2.3: Research on how to incorporate climate change, green transition and gender & youth considerations into the AfCFTA services liberalization, development/harmonisation of African standards, and phase II and III negotiations.
Knowledge production on options for incorporating considerations on climate change, green transition and women & youth into the Phase II and III negotiations.

actual.value: A concept note has been prepared to summarise the objectives, scope, methodology and timelines for the 5 research papers. CN currently being reviewed by UNCTAD partnering in this initiative. Expert consultants to be hired in November/December to lead the preparation of the research papers. Following this, the five research papers will be: 1) Compiled into a single joint publication with UNCTAD; 2) Translated into digestible policy briefs to be shared (along with the consolidated publication) with AUC, AfCFTA Secretariat and African trade negotiators.

target.value: Policy briefs produced for AUC, AfCFTA trade negotiators and the secretary general.

title.narrative: Output 3.1: Data and modelling work activities on trade, green growth and women/youth. Identifying the potential for green growth and inclusion of issues related to women/youth in the context of the AfCFTA.
Number of studies conducted.

target.value: One completed empirical study produced and disseminated that includes recommendations on green growth, sustainable practices and inclusion of women/youth in the context of the AfCFTA.

actual.value: Data work has started for Niger. ECA entered a Partnership with the Centre for International Research and Economic Modelling (CIREM) to undertake the analytical work on produce two studies. Modelling work in preparation of the first empirical study is ongoing and will end in February/March 2022. The second study is anticipated to be completed by end of August 2022

target.value: One completed empirical study produced and disseminated that includes recommendations on green growth, sustainable practices and inclusion of women/youth in the context of the AfCFTA.
One completed empirical study produced and disseminated that includes recommendations on green growth, sustainable practices and inclusion of women/youth in the context of the AfCFTA.

title.narrative: Output 3.2: Inclusion of green initiatives in AfCFTA National Implementation Strategies.
Number of countries supported with ‘greening’ their National Implementation Strategies.

target.value: Completion of national stakeholder meetings. Necessary value chain analysis, policy briefs and research papers produced.

actual.value:
Ongoing in collaboration with UNCTAD and the first set of consultations at national levels will start in September 2021. The work will carry on until the end of the project.
Way forward: Pilot the ECA-UNCTAD methodology in one country asap, and aim to start working with five countries on green-focused AfCFTA implementation strategies in December 2021, in line with achieving the 20-country target by the end of the project.

title.narrative: Output 2.4: Knowledge products on private sector finance and investments towards green growth prepared and disseminated.
Studies and dissemination activities.

target.value: 4 Advocacy forums held in RECs share information on green investments opportunities.
4 Advocacy forums held in RECs share information on green investments opportunities.
Preparation of 1 research paper and 1 policy brief.

actual.value: Preparations ongoing and completion expected in February 2022 followed by dissemination throughout the duration of the project.

title.narrative: Output 2.5: Deliver targeted trainings to business associations (incl. women’s business associations, cross border trade associations and youth groups on entrepreneurship) in five African countries on the business opportunities connected to the AfCFTA, that also include a focus on ´green´ investment opportunities.
Number of business associations and countries that have received training.

target.value: Target countries and business associations identified.

actual.value: Due to COVID-19 restrictions in 2020, we did not deliver these trainings. Not completed

target.value: 2 countries and minimum 10 business associations (40% women’s associations and 20 % youth).
2 country and minimum 5 business associations (40 % women’s associations and 20 % youth).
2 countries and minimum 10 business associations (40% women’s associations and 20 % youth).

actual.value: The modality of delivery required travel in the country. Now that modalities of work around COVID-19 restrictions have been consolidated. We expect the activity to start. First series of trainings scheduled for March 2022.

title.narrative: Outcome 2: Enhanced capacity of Member States to develop policies, and mainstream considerations on climate change and green transition into negotiations on competition, investment, IPRs (phase II) and e-commerce (phase III), and implementation of the service protocol and TBT Annex (Phase I).
Number of countries and RECs that apply UNECA research on competition, investment, and climate change/green transition in phase II negotiations and phase I implementation.
Outcome 3: Enhanced capacity of member states to include considerations on climate change and green transition into their AfCFTA National Implementation Strategies.
Number of member states with AfCFTA National Implementation Strategies with a clear green and evidence-based strategy.

target.value: Minimum 20 countries have included green growth in their AfCFTA National Implementation Strategies (including smaller economies, LLDCs and SIDSs that face specific climate challenges and capacity constraints).

title.narrative: Outcome 1: Enhanced capacity of member States and RECs to implement AfCFTA phase I issues and roll out policies to govern the interface of the AfCFTA with existing trade agreements.

Number of Member States, regional economic communities and pan-African institutions that are using ECA proposed policies to design, implement and monitor programmes on AfCFTA phase I and govern the interface of the AfCFTA and existing free trade agreements

Output 2.2: Study on “Towards A Common Investment Area in the Africa Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA): levelling the playing field for intra-African 87 investment, competition and intellectual property” is produced and disseminated.

Progress and dissemination of study.
Number of countries using ECA proposed policies based on study.

actual.value: Study finished and is ongoing publication processes concluded in August 2021. The dissemination will start in October 2021

Study has been cleared by the Executive Secretary of ECA and will be presented during the Committee Meeting for consideration and adoption of the report and its policy recommendations, for subsequent work to support the uptake of policies in member States. Toolkits and materials being prepared to build capacity and inform AfCFTA negotiations.

title.narrative: 1.3: The 10th Report on Assessing Regional Integration in Africa (ARIA X) on the theme: “Services Trade under the AfCFTA” is produced and disseminated.

Progress and dissemination of ARIA X report.
Number of countries using ECA proposed policies based on report.

target.value: 6 countries using ECA proposed policies, including policies adopted incorporating climate concerns and adaptation responses.
8 countries using ECA proposed policies, including policies adopted incorporating climate concerns and adaptation responses.
ARIA X report completed and disseminated to 30 countries.

actual.value: The Report completed and publication work concluded in August 2021. Dissemination to start in September 2021.

target.value: 6 countries using ECA proposed policies, including policies adopted incorporating climate concerns and adaptation responses.

actual.value:
The Report completed and publication work concluded in August 2021. Dissemination to start in September 2021.
Regarding the indicators we expect to meet them before the end of the project with a balance of achievements between 2022 and 2023. Progress will be presented to Denmark in June of 2022.

Progress and dissemination of study.
Number of RECS using ECA proposed policies based on study.

target.value: 3 RECs using ECA proposed policies. Policies adopted mainstream climate concerns, adaptation responses and considerations on women/ youth.
3 RECs using ECA proposed policies. Policies adopted mainstream climate concerns, adaptation responses and considerations on women/ youth.

actual.value: The Report completed and publication work concluded in August 2021. Dissemination to start in September 2021.

target.value: 2 RECs using ECA proposed policies. Policies adopted mainstream climate concerns, adaptation responses and considerations on women/youth.

actual.value:
The Report completed and publication work concluded in August 2021. Dissemination to start in September 2021.
regarding the indicators we expect to meet them before the end of the project with a balance of achievements between 2022 and 2023. Progress will be presented to Denmark in June of 2022.

title.narrative: Output 2.1: Competition Market Studies are produced for African Competition Councils.
10 countries that develop market studies on competition.

actual.value: The two market studies with policies recommendations will start in October 2021 and be available in December 2021
